'''Solrock''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ソルロック''' ''Solrock'') is a dual-type {{2t|Rock|Psychic}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It is not known to [[Evolution|evolve]] into or from any other Pokémon, but it is considered to be a counterpart of {{p|Lunatone}}.

==Biology==
Solrock is a primarily orange, spherical Pokémon. It has eight yellow, rocky spines extending from the sides of its body, and multiple small, yellow stony bumps running vertically along its center. On its back are dual rocky mounds, situated to the sides of the midline. Its large eyes consist of thick, semicircular yellow eyelids through which black sclera and red pupils can be seen. A black ring with six extensions surrounds each eye.

Solrock relies on solar energy, which it absorbs in groups during daylight. While it is always expressionless, it is able to sense the emotions and thoughts of others. It spins its body to produce intense heat and a blinding light. It is able to stay silent while floating in the air, and can be found in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Cave Pokémon|caves.}}

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Lily Solrock.png|thumb|250px|left|Solrock in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[Tate's Solrock]]=====
A {{TP|Tate|Solrock}} appeared in ''[[AG099|It's Still Rocket Roll to Me!]]'' and ''[[AG100|Solid as a Solrock]]'', under the ownership of [[Tate and Liza|Tate]].

=====Other=====
Solrock made its main series debut in ''[[AG063|Take the Lombre Home]]''. A group of people blamed a wild Solrock for a drought in their village, when it was actually {{TRT}} stealing their water. The Solrock redeemed its reputation when it helped to get rid of Team Rocket.

{{FB|Pyramid King|Brandon}} used his Solrock in a battle against {{Ash}} in ''[[AG190|Pace - The Final Frontier!]]''. Solrock battled against {{AP|Squirtle}} and won before going up against {{AP|Bulbasaur}} which ended in a tie.

A Solrock appeared in ''[[M18|Hoopa and the Clash of Ages]]'', under the ownership of [[Baraz]]. Baraz used Solrock to light up dark places.

A Solrock appeared in ''[[XY091|A Performance Pop Quiz!]]'', under the ownership of {{kal|Lily}}. It was seen participating in the [[Anistar City]] [[Pokémon Showcase]]. It appeared again in ''[[XY101|A Dancing Debut!]]'' during the [[Couriway Town]] Pokémon Showcase.

====Minor appearances====
Solrock debuted in the opening sequence of ''[[M06|Jirachi: Wish Maker]]'', where a {{pkmn|Trainer}} used it alongside a {{p|Manectric}} in a [[Double Battle]] against {{ga|Brendan}}.

A Solrock appeared in ''[[DP049|Dawn's Early Night!]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Coordinator}}. It was used along with a {{p|Lunatone}} for the [[Double Performance]] required during the {{ci|Hearthome}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

A Solrock appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Tate Solrock Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Solrock in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Tate's Solrock}}
As in the games, one of [[Tate and Liza|Tate]]'s main Pokémon is a Solrock that the twins use in conjunction with {{p|Lunatone}} in [[Double Battle]]s. It first appeared in ''[[PS288|I'm Always Grumpig First Thing in the Morning II]]''.

Solrock appeared in a fantasy in ''[[PS414|Double Trouble with Dialga and Palkia IV]]''.

===In the Pokémon Ruby-Sapphire manga===
A Solrock appeared in ''[[PMRS16|Death Match Between Summer And Winter!]]''.

==Trivia==
* Solrock shares its {{pkmn|category}} with its counterpart {{p|Lunatone}}. They are both known as the Meteorite Pokémon.
* Solrock and Lunatone have nearly identical base [[Statistic|stats]], with only the physical and special stats switched.

===Origin===
Solrock is based on the {{wp|sun}}, as well as a {{wp|meteorite}}.

===Name origin===
Solrock is a combination of ''sol'' (Latin for ''sun'') and ''rock''.
